'''Transmission''' is a lightweight [[BitTorrent client]] which features a simple interface on top of a [[cross-platform]] back-end. It is [[free software|free]] and [[open source software]], mostly licensed under the [[MIT License]]. Transmission runs on [[Linux]] and other [[Unix-like]] [[operating system|systems]] ([[GTK+]] interface), [[Mac OS X]] ([[Cocoa (API)|Cocoa]] interface) and [[BeOS]]/[[Magnussoft ZETA|ZETA]] (native interface). On [[14 January]] [[2008]], it was adopted as the default Bittorrent client in the popular [[Linux]] distribution [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]].<ref name="Ubuntu Changelog">{{cite web|url=http://changelogs.ubuntu.com/changelogs/pool/main/u/ubuntu-meta/ubuntu-meta_1.87/changelog|title=Ubuntu Changelog|last=Pitt|first=Martin|date=2008-01-14|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-15}}</ref> An unofficial port of Transmission (with a [[command-line interface]]) to the [[iPhone OS]] was accomplished on [[March 3]], [[2008]].<ref>[http://wickedpsyched.net/iphone/torrent P2P torrent on the iPhone, a sad tale of woe, misery, abject failure... and then eventually success!] by WickedPsyched.net, March 3, 2008</ref> As of [[January 10]], [[2008]], Transmission has had over 230,000 downloads.<ref name="Proposing Transmission BitTorrent client as default">{{cite web|url=http://www.mail-archive.com/ubuntu-desktop@lists.ubuntu.com/msg01338.html|title=Re: Proposing Transmission BitTorrent client as default|last=Kerr|first=Charles|date=January 10, 2008|publisher=mail-archive.com|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-04}}</ref> It is the most popular BitTorrent client downloaded from Mac software website [[MacUpdate]].
+
'''Transmission''' is a free lightweight [[BitTorrent client]] which features a simple interface on top of a [[cross-platform]] back-end. It is [[free software|free]] and [[open source software]], mostly licensed under the [[MIT License]]. Transmission runs on [[Linux]] and other [[Unix-like]] [[operating system|systems]] ([[GTK+]] interface), [[Mac OS X]] ([[Cocoa (API)|Cocoa]] interface) and [[BeOS]]/[[Magnussoft ZETA|ZETA]] (native interface). On [[14 January]] [[2008]], it was adopted as the default Bittorrent client in the popular [[Linux]] distribution [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]].<ref name="Ubuntu Changelog">{{cite web|url=http://changelogs.ubuntu.com/changelogs/pool/main/u/ubuntu-meta/ubuntu-meta_1.87/changelog|title=Ubuntu Changelog|last=Pitt|first=Martin|date=2008-01-14|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-15}}</ref> An unofficial port of Transmission (with a [[command-line interface]]) to the [[iPhone OS]] was accomplished on [[March 3]], [[2008]].<ref>[http://wickedpsyched.net/iphone/torrent P2P torrent on the iPhone, a sad tale of woe, misery, abject failure... and then eventually success!] by WickedPsyched.net, March 3, 2008</ref> As of [[January 10]], [[2008]], Transmission has had over 230,000 downloads.<ref name="Proposing Transmission BitTorrent client as default">{{cite web|url=http://www.mail-archive.com/ubuntu-desktop@lists.ubuntu.com/msg01338.html|title=Re: Proposing Transmission BitTorrent client as default|last=Kerr|first=Charles|date=January 10, 2008|publisher=mail-archive.com|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-04}}</ref> It is the most popular BitTorrent client downloaded from Mac software website [[MacUpdate]].
Transmission uses a smaller amount of system resources than many other BitTorrent clients (such as [[Vuze (client)|Vuze]]).<ref name="Transmission Becomes Default BitTorrent Client for Ubuntu">{{cite web|url=http://torrentfreak.com/transmission-bittorrent-client-ubuntu-080130/|title=Transmission Becomes Default BitTorrent Client for Ubuntu|date=January 30, 2008|publisher=[[TorrentFreak]]|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-04}}</ref> The project aims to strike a balance between providing useful functionality without feature bloat. Keeping the interface simple and intuitive on all platforms is a key design goal.<ref name="About Transmission">{{cite web|url=http://www.transmissionbt.com/about.php|title=About Transmission|publisher=www.transmissionbt.com|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-15}}</ref>
Transmission uses a smaller amount of system resources than many other BitTorrent clients (such as [[Vuze (client)|Vuze]]).<ref name="Transmission Becomes Default BitTorrent Client for Ubuntu">{{cite web|url=http://torrentfreak.com/transmission-bittorrent-client-ubuntu-080130/|title=Transmission Becomes Default BitTorrent Client for Ubuntu|date=January 30, 2008|publisher=[[TorrentFreak]]|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-04}}</ref> The project aims to strike a balance between providing useful functionality without feature bloat. Keeping the interface simple and intuitive on all platforms is a key design goal.<ref name="About Transmission">{{cite web|url=http://www.transmissionbt.com/about.php|title=About Transmission|publisher=www.transmissionbt.com|language=en|accessdate=2008-05-15}}</ref>
